description: An interface for a simple searchable blog, as an example of an Elm JSON API spec.

IndexUrl.description: A link to the API entry-point.

SearchUrl.description: A link to the results of a search.

q.description: A set of keywords to search for, separated by spaces.

size.description: The number of results to return.

after.description: The id of a hit. The given hit and any results which appear before it will be skipped.

ArticleUrl.description: A link to the content of an article.

Index.description: A directory of available services provided by the API.

self.description: The canonical url of the service.

search.description: A link to the search service.

featured.description: A featured article, suitable for displaying on the home screen.

Some.description: The query was valid and has results.

None.description: The query was valid, but there were no matching results.

SearchHit.description: A single result for a search query.

href.description: A link to the article content.

title.description: The title of the matching article.

snippet.description: A snippet of relevant text from the matching article.

created.description: The date the first version of the article was published.

updated.description: The date the article was last updated. Will be missing if this is the first published version.

body.description: The main body of the article.

NewArticleResponse.description: A response to a request to publish a new article.

NewDraft.description: A draft of a new article.

body.description: The main body of the article.

base.description: The version of the original copy of this article.

UpdateArticleResponse.description: The response to a request to update an existing article

Ok.description: The update was a success. The result is the updated article, including the submitted changes.

Outdated.description: The update could not be completed because the draft is based on a version that has been superseded. The result is the latest version of the article, without any of the submitted changes.

body.description: The main body of the article.

base.description: The version of the original copy of this article.
